Submodules¶

gillespy2.solvers.numpy.CLE_solver module¶

Class and methods for the CLE Solver

class gillespy2.solvers.numpy.CLE_solver.CLESolver(model=None, debug=False, profile=False)[source]¶

Bases: gillespy2.core.gillespySolver.GillesPySolver

A Chemical Langevin Equation Solver for GillesPy2 models.

TODO: fix This solver uses an algorithm calculates multiple reactions in a single step over a given tau step size. The change in propensities over this step are bounded by bounding the relative change in state, yielding greatly improved run-time performance with very little trade-off in accuracy.

classmethod get_solver_settings()[source]¶
Returns

Tuple of strings, denoting all keyword argument for this solvers run() method.

name = 'CLESolver'¶
pause_event = None¶
rc = 0¶
result = None¶
run(model=None, t=20, number_of_trajectories=1, increment=None, seed=None, debug=False, profile=False, live_output=None, live_output_options={}, timeout=None, resume=None, tau_tol=0.03, **kwargs)[source]¶

Function calling simulation of the model. This is typically called by the run function in GillesPy2 model objects and will inherit those parameters which are passed with the model as the arguments this run function.

Parameters

  • model (gillespy2.Model) – GillesPy2 model object to simulate

  • t (int) – Simulation run time

  • number_of_trajectories (int) – Number of trajectories to simulate

  • increment (float) – Save point increment for recording data

  • seed (int) – The random seed for the simulation. Optional, defaults to None

  • debug (bool) – Set to True to provide additional debug information about the simulation

  • profile (bool) – Set to True to provide information about step size (tau) taken at each step.

  • live_output (str) – The type of output to be displayed by solver. Can be “progress”, “text”, or “graph”.

  • live_output_options (dict) – COntains options for live_output. By default {“interval”:1}. “interval” specifies seconds between displaying. “clear_output” specifies if display should be refreshed with each display.

  • timeout –

  • resume –

  • tau_tol –

  • kwargs –

Returns

stop_event = None¶

gillespy2.solvers.numpy.ode_solver module¶

GillesPy2 Solver for ODE solutions.

class gillespy2.solvers.numpy.ode_solver.ODESolver(model=None)[source]¶

Bases: gillespy2.core.gillespySolver.GillesPySolver

This Solver produces the deterministic continuous solution via ODE.

classmethod get_solver_settings()[source]¶
Returns

Tuple of strings, denoting all keyword argument for this solvers run() method.

name = 'ODESolver'¶
pause_event = None¶
rc = 0¶
result = None¶
run(model=None, t=None, number_of_trajectories=1, increment=None, show_labels=True, integrator='lsoda', integrator_options={}, live_output=None, live_output_options={}, timeout=None, resume=None, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters

  • model – gillespy2.model class object

  • t – end time of simulation

  • number_of_trajectories – Should be 1. This is deterministic and will always have same results

  • increment – time step increment for plotting

  • integrator – integrator to be used form scipy.integrate.ode. Options include ‘vode’, ‘zvode’, ‘lsoda’, ‘dopri5’, and ‘dop853’. For more details, see https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.ode.html

  • integrator_options – a dictionary containing options to the scipy integrator. for a list of options, see https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.ode.html. Example use: {max_step : 0, rtol : .01}

  • timeout (int) – If set, if simulation takes longer than timeout, will exit.

  • resume – Result of a previously run simulation, to be resumed

  • live_output – str The type of output to be displayed by solver. Can be “progress”, “text”, or “graph”.

  • live_output_options – dictionary contains options for live_output. By default {“interval”:1}. “interval” specifies seconds between displaying. “clear_output” specifies if display should be refreshed with each displa

stop_event = None¶

gillespy2.solvers.numpy.ssa_solver module¶

class gillespy2.solvers.numpy.ssa_solver.NumPySSASolver(model=None)[source]¶

Bases: gillespy2.core.gillespySolver.GillesPySolver

get_solver_settings()[source]¶
Returns

Tuple of strings, denoting all keyword argument for this solvers run() method.

name = 'NumPySSASolver'¶
pause_event = None¶
rc = 0¶
result = None¶
run(model=None, t=None, number_of_trajectories=1, increment=None, seed=None, debug=False, show_labels=True, live_output=None, live_output_options={}, timeout=None, resume=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Run the SSA algorithm using a NumPy for storing the data in arrays and generating the timeline.

Parameters

  • model – The model on which the solver will operate.

  • t – The end time of the solver.

  • number_of_trajectories – The number of times to sample the chemical master equation. Each trajectory will be returned at the end of the simulation.

  • increment – The time step of the solution.

  • seed – The random seed for the simulation. Defaults to None.

  • debug – Set to True to provide additional debug information about the simulation.

  • resume – Result of a previously run simulation, to be resumed

  • live_output – str The type of output to be displayed by solver. Can be “progress”, “text”, or “graph”.

  • live_output_options – dictionary contains options for live_output. By default {“interval”:1}. “interval” specifies seconds between displaying. “clear_output” specifies if display should be refreshed with each display

Returns

a list of each trajectory simulated.

stop_event = None¶

gillespy2.solvers.numpy.tau_hybrid_solver module¶

class gillespy2.solvers.numpy.tau_hybrid_solver.TauHybridSolver(model=None)[source]¶

Bases: gillespy2.core.gillespySolver.GillesPySolver

This Solver uses a root-finding interpretation of the direct SSA method, along with ODE solvers to simulate ODE and Stochastic systems interchangeably or simultaneously.

classmethod get_solver_settings()[source]¶
Returns

Tuple of strings, denoting all keyword argument for this solvers run() method.

classmethod get_supported_features()[source]¶
name = 'TauHybridSolver'¶
rc = 0¶
result = None¶
run(model=None, t=None, number_of_trajectories=1, increment=None, seed=None, debug=False, profile=False, tau_tol=0.03, event_sensitivity=100, integrator='LSODA', integrator_options={}, live_output=None, live_output_options={}, timeout=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Function calling simulation of the model. This is typically called by the run function in GillesPy2 model objects and will inherit those parameters which are passed with the model as the arguments this run function.

Parameters

  • model (GillesPy2.model) – GillesPy2 model object to simulate

  • t (int) – Simulation run time

  • number_of_trajectories (int) – The number of times to sample the chemical master equation. Each trajectory will be returned at the end of the simulation. Optional, defaults to 1. Number of trajectories to simulate

  • increment (float) – Save point increment for recording data

  • seed (int) – The random seed for the simulation. Optional, defaults to None.

  • debug (bool) – Set to True to provide additional debug information about the simulation.

  • profile (bool) – Set to True to provide information about step size (tau) taken at each step.

  • tau_tol (float) – Tolerance level for Tau leaping algorithm. Larger tolerance values will result in larger tau steps. Default value is 0.03.

  • event_sensitivity (int) – Number of data points to be inspected between integration steps/save points for event detection

  • integrator_options (dict) – contains options to the scipy integrator. by default, this includes rtol=1e-9 and atol=1e-12. for a list of options, see https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.LSODA.html. Example use: {max_step : 0, rtol : .01}

  • live_output (str) – The type of output to be displayed by solver. Can be “progress”, “text”, or “graph”.

  • live_output_options (str) – contains options for live_output. By default {“interval”:1}. “interval” specifies seconds between displaying. “clear_output” specifies if display should be refreshed with each display

stop_event = None¶

gillespy2.solvers.numpy.tau_leaping_solver module¶

Class and methods for the Tau Leaping Solver

class gillespy2.solvers.numpy.tau_leaping_solver.TauLeapingSolver(model=None, debug=False, profile=False)[source]¶

Bases: gillespy2.core.gillespySolver.GillesPySolver

A Tau Leaping Solver for GillesPy2 models. This solver uses an algorithm calculates multiple reactions in a single step over a given tau step size. The change in propensities over this step are bounded by bounding the relative change in state, yielding greatly improved run-time performance with very little trade-off in accuracy.

classmethod get_solver_settings()[source]¶
Returns

Tuple of strings, denoting all keyword argument for this solvers run() method.

name = 'TauLeapingSolver'¶

rc = 0¶
result = None¶

Function calling simulation of the model. This is typically called by the run function in GillesPy2 model objects and will inherit those parameters which are passed with the model as the arguments this run function.

Parameters

  • model (gillespy2.Model) – GillesPy2 model object to simulate

  • t (int) – Simulation run time

  • number_of_trajectories (int) – Number of trajectories to simulate

  • increment (float) – Save point increment for recording data

  • seed (int) – The random seed for the simulation. Optional, defaults to None

  • debug (bool) – Set to True to provide additional debug information about the simulation

  • profile (bool) – Set to True to provide information about step size (tau) taken at each step.

  • live_output (str) – The type of output to be displayed by solver. Can be “progress”, “text”, or “graph”.

  • live_output_options (dict) – COntains options for live_output. By default {“interval”:1}. “interval” specifies seconds between displaying. “clear_output” specifies if display should be refreshed with each display.

  • timeout –

  • resume –

  • tau_tol –

run(model=None, t=None, number_of_trajectories=1, increment=None, seed=None, debug=False, show_labels=True, live_output=None, live_output_options={}, timeout=None, resume=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Run the SSA algorithm using a NumPy for storing the data in arrays and generating the timeline.

Parameters

  • model – The model on which the solver will operate.

  • t – The end time of the solver.

  • number_of_trajectories – The number of times to sample the chemical master equation. Each trajectory will be returned at the end of the simulation.

  • increment – The time step of the solution.

  • seed – The random seed for the simulation. Defaults to None.

  • debug – Set to True to provide additional debug information about the simulation.

  • resume – Result of a previously run simulation, to be resumed

  • live_output – str The type of output to be displayed by solver. Can be “progress”, “text”, or “graph”.

  • live_output_options – dictionary contains options for live_output. By default {“interval”:1}. “interval” specifies seconds between displaying. “clear_output” specifies if display should be refreshed with each display

Returns

a list of each trajectory simulated.

run(model=None, t=None, number_of_trajectories=1, increment=None, show_labels=True, integrator='lsoda', integrator_options={}, live_output=None, live_output_options={}, timeout=None, resume=None, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters

  • model – gillespy2.model class object

  • t – end time of simulation

  • number_of_trajectories – Should be 1. This is deterministic and will always have same results

  • increment – time step increment for plotting

  • integrator – integrator to be used form scipy.integrate.ode. Options include ‘vode’, ‘zvode’, ‘lsoda’, ‘dopri5’, and ‘dop853’. For more details, see https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.ode.html

  • integrator_options – a dictionary containing options to the scipy integrator. for a list of options, see https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.ode.html. Example use: {max_step : 0, rtol : .01}

  • timeout (int) – If set, if simulation takes longer than timeout, will exit.

  • resume – Result of a previously run simulation, to be resumed

  • live_output – str The type of output to be displayed by solver. Can be “progress”, “text”, or “graph”.

  • live_output_options – dictionary contains options for live_output. By default {“interval”:1}. “interval” specifies seconds between displaying. “clear_output” specifies if display should be refreshed with each displa

run(model=None, t=None, number_of_trajectories=1, increment=None, seed=None, debug=False, profile=False, tau_tol=0.03, event_sensitivity=100, integrator='LSODA', integrator_options={}, live_output=None, live_output_options={}, timeout=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Function calling simulation of the model. This is typically called by the run function in GillesPy2 model objects and will inherit those parameters which are passed with the model as the arguments this run function.

Parameters

  • model (GillesPy2.model) – GillesPy2 model object to simulate

  • t (int) – Simulation run time

  • number_of_trajectories (int) – The number of times to sample the chemical master equation. Each trajectory will be returned at the end of the simulation. Optional, defaults to 1. Number of trajectories to simulate

  • increment (float) – Save point increment for recording data

  • seed (int) – The random seed for the simulation. Optional, defaults to None.

  • debug (bool) – Set to True to provide additional debug information about the simulation.

  • profile (bool) – Set to True to provide information about step size (tau) taken at each step.

  • tau_tol (float) – Tolerance level for Tau leaping algorithm. Larger tolerance values will result in larger tau steps. Default value is 0.03.

  • event_sensitivity (int) – Number of data points to be inspected between integration steps/save points for event detection

  • integrator_options (dict) – contains options to the scipy integrator. by default, this includes rtol=1e-9 and atol=1e-12. for a list of options, see https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.LSODA.html. Example use: {max_step : 0, rtol : .01}

  • live_output (str) – The type of output to be displayed by solver. Can be “progress”, “text”, or “graph”.

  • live_output_options (str) – contains options for live_output. By default {“interval”:1}. “interval” specifies seconds between displaying. “clear_output” specifies if display should be refreshed with each display

A Tau Leaping Solver for GillesPy2 models. This solver uses an algorithm calculates multiple reactions in a single step over a given tau step size. The change in propensities over this step are bounded by bounding the relative change in state, yielding greatly improved run-time performance with very little trade-off in accuracy.
